overview: From 2025-05-29 to 2025-05-30, elizaos/eliza had 11 new PRs (3 merged), 1 new issues, and 13 active contributors.

topIssues.title: plugin-evm Fails to Load
topIssues.author: omariosman
topIssues.body:
Any idea on how to create an eliza AI agent that is able to perform evm operations on behalf me?

# Description

The `@elizaos-plugins/plugin-evm` plugin fails to load in ElizaOS due to a missing `@elizaos/plugin-tee` dependency, despite being installed correctly per the ElizaOS documentation.

# Error
```
Failed to import plugin: @elizaos-plugins/plugin-evm Error: Cannot find package '/home/omarosman23/Documents/learn/ai-agents/eliza/packages/plugin-evm/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-tee/' imported from /home/omarosman23/Documents/learn/ai-agents/eliza/packages/plugin-evm/dist/index.js
```

# Steps to Reproduce

## Installation
Installed plugin: `npx elizaos plugins add @elizaos-plugins/plugin-evm` and verified plugin in `packages/plugin-evm`



## Configured .env:
```
EVM_PRIVATE_KEY=0x<redacted>
EVM_PROVIDER_URL=<my-rpc-url>
```


## Updated character.json:
```
{
  "name": "Eliza",
  "plugins": ["@elizaos-plugins/plugin-evm"],
  "modelProvider": "openrouter",
  "settings": { "chains": { "evm": ["baseSepolia"] } }
}
```


## Run agent: 
`pnpm start --characters="characters/example-character.json"`

## Expected Behavior

Plugin should load and enable EVM actions (e.g., send ETH, check balance).

## Actual Behavior

Plugin fails to load due to missing `@elizaos/plugin-tee dependency`
I installed `@elizaos/plugin-tee dependency` but the same issue presists

## Environment
```
Node.js: v23.3.0
pnpm: v8.14.3
ElizaOS: 0.25.9
OS: Ubuntu 22.04
```


Any idea on how to create an eliza AI agent that is able to perform evm operations on behalf me?

topPRs.title: docs: comprehensive CLI docs standardization, updates, and accuracy fixes
topPRs.author: yungalgo
topPRs.body:
**Problem:**

CLI documentation across all commands contained critical inaccuracies and inconsistencies:
Command descriptions didn't match actual CLI help output
Incorrect aliases and missing options throughout
Non-existent commands referenced in quickstart guide
Inconsistent formatting and missing comprehensive examples
Command ordering didn't match CLI structure
JSON examples used unprofessional notation ("etc...")

**Solution:**

Systematically verified and standardized ALL CLI documentation against actual CLI help output:
âœ… CLI Verification: Retrieved help output for every command and subcommand
âœ… Complete Accuracy: All descriptions, options, and aliases now match CLI exactly
âœ… Comprehensive Examples: Added detailed usage examples with realistic names
âœ… Consistent Structure: Applied standardized format across all command docs
âœ… Professional Standards: Fixed JSON notation and technical documentation standards

**Details:**

14 files updated with 2,122+ additions, 1,309 deletions
Command Order: Fixed overview.md to match exact CLI help order

Critical Fixes:
Test command: -n, --name <name> â†’ -n, --name <n> (matches CLI)
Plugins: Fixed incorrect aliases (remove|delete â†’ remove|delete)
Agent: All subcommands and options now accurate
Publish: Added registry guidance and continuous development workflow
Removed Invalid Commands: Cleaned up quickstart.md references to non-existent commands
Enhanced UX: Added comprehensive troubleshooting and workflow guidance

**Validation Method:**

Every command change verified against elizaos [command] --help output to ensure 100% accuracy.

**Impact:**

ðŸŽ¯ Perfect CLI Alignment: Documentation now matches CLI behavior exactly
ðŸ“š Professional Quality: Comprehensive examples and troubleshooting
ðŸ”§ Developer Experience: Accurate guidance reduces confusion and support burden
ðŸš€ User Onboarding: Quickstart guide now works seamlessly

topPRs.title: feat: Added AI/ML API model provider
topPRs.author: D1m7asis
topPRs.body:
## Relates to

N/A

## Risks

**Low** - this change adds a new model provider without affecting existing functionality.

## Background

### What does this PR do?

This PR adds support for the **AI/ML API** model provider.
Key changes include:

* Integration using the `createOpenAI()` interface;
* Support for text and object generation using AI/ML API models;
* Environment variable support for small, medium, and large models;
* Centralized model configuration via `models.ts`;
* Updated environment example and documentation.

### What kind of change is this?

âœ… **Feature** - non-breaking addition of new functionality.

## Documentation changes needed?

âœ… Yes - documentation was updated in `docs/guides/configuration.md`.

## Testing

### Where should a reviewer start?

* `packages/core/src/generation.ts` - generation logic for AI/ML API
* `packages/core/src/models.ts` - model configuration
* `.env.example` and `docs` - environment variable usage

### Detailed testing steps

1. Set the `AIMLAPI_API_KEY` and one of the `*_AIMLAPI_MODEL` env vars.
2. Trigger a generation using the `aimlapi` provider.
3. Verify correct model selection and response.
4. Optionally test `generateObject()` using a schema and the AI/ML API backend.
